title: US tech firms grapple with latest curbs on China’s Inspur
description: US tech firms are assessing if they need to halt sales to Inspur's subsidiaries as the parent is on an export curb list.

title: US Republican leader Ron DeSantis lays out right-wing platform
description: Florida governor argues US should be more like his right-leaning state in speech seen as presidential campaign preview.

title: Colombia, Ecuador work to protect Indigenous people from attacks
description: South American states launch a joint alert system as Awa communities come under attack by armed groups.

title: Massive nationwide strike hits France over pension reform
description: More than a million join protests against French President Emmanuel Macron's plan to push retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: French workers stage massive strike against pension reform
description: More than 1.28 million people took to the streets in France as unions intensify fight against Macron's pension reform.

title: Will the UN’s plea to help Rohingya refugees be answered?
description: The UN is appealing to global powers to help Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh.

title: US sues to stop JetBlue’s deal for Spirit, cites consumer harm
description: US DOJ said the merger would price out cost-conscious fliers as it would result in fewer seats and hence higher fares.

title: How does the UK government plan to stop the Channel crossings?
description: Newly proposed legislation would mean unauthorised arrivals will be prevented from claiming asylum and deported.

title: Videos of police brutality can perpetuate Black trauma
description: The wanton display of footage of violent Black deaths re-traumatises Black communities and promotes racist tropes.

title: US Fed’s Powell opens door to higher, faster interest rate hikes
description: Stronger-than-expected economic data indicates Fed may need to do more large rate hikes to temper inflation, he said.

title: Biden proposes taxes on the rich to cover Medicare expenses
description: US President Joe Biden is expected to unveil his proposed budget on Thursday as he prepares for likely re-election bid.

title: New UN rights chief opens ‘communication’ with China
description: Volker Türk's first speech falls short of activists' hopes for a tougher stand after UN report on abuses in Xinjiang.

title: Bolsonaro’s son says father returning to Brazil, deletes tweet
description: Ex-President Jair Bolsonaro went to US after losing re-election but has suggested he could return to lead opposition.

title: Two Americans dead, one injured in Mexico kidnapping: Official
description: Mexican official says two Americans abducted in Mexico are dead, two alive after Matomoros kidnapping.

title: Israeli forces kill at least 6 Palestinians in latest Jenin raid
description: At least 11 people wounded, including two with serious injuries, the Palestinian health ministry says.

title: UEFA to refund Liverpool fans for Champions League final chaos
description: Independent review found UEFA mostly responsible for security failures at last year's final in Paris.

title: Pentagon chief, on surprise trip, says US troops to stay in Iraq
description: In Baghdad, Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin pledges continued US troop presence in fight against ISIL.

title: Suspects of group that destroyed Russian plane detained: Belarus
description: Belarusian anti-government activists last month said they had blown up a Russian military surveillance aircraft.

title: Bangladesh: Deadly explosion hits commercial building in Dhaka
description: The explosion took place inside a five-storey building in a bustling commercial district in the Bangladeshi capital.

title: Earthquake damage in Turkey set to exceed $100bn, UN says
description: Recovery costs 'will obviously exceed that amount' after last month's 'apocalyptic' destruction, UN official says

title: Concerns mount over UN food aid cut for Rohingya in Bangladesh
description: The UN and Bangladesh government call for more international aid to help the refugees as they face a 'difficult year'.

title: Czech company sees boom in market for fake HIMARS tanks
description: Firm adds HIMARS to its fleet of over 30 types of inflatable real-size decoys as Russia's war in Ukraine continues.

title: Pension reform protests in France: What you need to know
description: Unions have pledged to continue protesting against proposed changes, including raising the retirement age from 62 to 64.

title: UK says plan to stop Channel crossings pushes bounds of law
description: UK set to announce details of proposed law, which has been heavily criticised by refugee rights groups.

title: China: Ties with Russia will ‘grow from strength to strength’
description: The world will have 'a driving force' with China and Russia working together, Beijing's foreign minister says.

title: N Korea could soon test new solid-fuel ICBM: Intelligence agency
description: South Korea’s National Intelligence Service says North Korea might be planning to hold large-scale military exercises.

title: ‘Rapidly decarbonise’: Energy industry must lead climate fight
description: UAE’s COP president says oil-and-gas industry must take charge of the battle against planetary warming.

title: Israel boycott bans are threatening our First Amendment rights
description: Democrats shouldn't look the other way as efforts to shield Israel from accountability erode our fundamental rights.

title: Israeli attack wounds Palestinians as settlers and soldiers dance
description: Five Palestinians wounded in settler attack in Huwara, where soldiers and settlers danced together celebrating Purim.

title: Qatar names new PM after resignation of Sheikh Khalid
description: Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani named by the emir as the country's new prime minister.

title: Turkey’s HDP ‘may support’ Kilicdaroglu in presidential polls
description: Pro-Kurdish party leader says HDP might back opposition candidate if they agreed on 'fundamental principles'.

title: Ukraine demands ICC probe into alleged prisoner of war killing
description: Investigation demanded after video on social media apparently shows Russian troops executing Ukraine soldier.

title: Smiling sphinx statue discovered in Egypt
description: Dimpled face may be a stylised representation of the Roman Emperor Claudius, an Egyptian research team said.

title: Photos: Landmine victims in Izyum, the liberated Ukrainian city
description: In this war-scarred city in Ukraine's northeast, residents scrutinise every step for landmines.

title: Somalia working to ‘stop violence’ amid Somaliland tension
description: In an interview with Al Jazeera, President Mohamud talks Somaliland, the fight against al-Shabab and Somalia's future.

title: 103 children among hundreds found in abandoned truck in Mexico
description: The people were found in good health and it was unclear why the truck driver parked and fled.

title: Sri Lanka expects IMF nod for $2.9bn package after China’s help
description: Nation expects final IMF approval in the third or fourth week of March, President Ranil Wickremesinghe tells parliament.

title: Australia’s wealth fund screens Chinese firms at risk of US bans
description: Chairman of Future Fund says screening portfolio as Biden administration plans new curbs for Chinese technology firms.

title: China FM warns of ‘conflict’ if US stays on path of confrontation
description: Foreign minister Qin Gang says the US engaged in 'malicious confrontation' rather than fair competition with Beijing.

title: Six Peruvian soldiers drown trying to flee protesters
description: Defence ministry said soldiers came under attack from people armed with slingshots and sticks at an anti-gov't protest.

title: Japan’s H3 rocket fails after liftoff in blow to space ambitions
description: JAXA intentionally destroys H3 rocket after the vehicle's second-stage engine failed to ignite following liftoff.

title: Will Russia sanctions dethrone ‘King Dollar’?
description: A flood of nations is trying to cut dependance on the dollar, fearing 'weaponisation' by the US. But it won't be easy.

title: Sri Lanka says ‘positive news’ coming from IMF on $2.9bn package
description: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to address parliament on progress made in IMF negotiations.

title: China blames Ukraine crisis on ‘invisible hand’
description: At wide-ranging press conference, Foreign Minister Qin Gang also describes Taiwan as a 'red line' in relations with US.

title: Southeast Asia the ‘new China’ for supply chains: business group
description: ASEAN Business Advisory Council chairperson Arsjad Rasjid says region should be 'supply chain of the world'.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 377
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 377th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Canada’s Trudeau orders probe of alleged China election dabbling
description: PM Trudeau and Canadian security officials have acknowledged interference attempts by China in Canada's elections.

title: N Korea warns US against shooting down its missile tests
description: Kim Yo Jong says North Korea will take any US attempt to intercept its missile launches as a 'declaration of war'.

title: Israeli attack puts Syria’s Aleppo airport out of service: Report
description: Syrian state media says Israeli missile attacks damaged the runway at the Aleppo International Airport.

title: At least 15 killed in Indonesia landslide, dozens missing
description: Landslide swept through homes in remote Serasan island on the edge of the South China Sea.

title: Bank of America CEO predicts ‘slight’ US recession this year
description: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan says he expects mild downturn in third quarter of 2023.

title: Legislators urged to raise Bahrain human rights at int’l assembly
description: Parliamentarians urged to raise severe restrictions on political freedom when they gather in Manama from March 11.

title: Q&A: Indonesia’s new capital chief Bambang Susantono
description: Man in charge of capital project tells Al Jazeera he is confident Nusantara will be a “liveable and loveable” place.

title: Brazil orders police probe into Bolsonaro jewellery scandal
description: A news outlet reported that jewels worth more than $3m were discovered in the backpack of a former aide in October 2021.

title: Defections from Myanmar military slow as generals tighten grip
description: Coup opponents say they are trying to recruit more informants as threats to those who leave intensify.
